text: Aspergillus germanicus is a species of fungus in the genus Aspergillus which has been isolated from indoor air in Germany. It is from the Usti section. ==Growth and morphology== A. germanicus has been cultivated on both Czapek yeast extract agar (CYA) plates and Malt Extract Agar Oxoid® (MEAOX) plates. The growth morphology of the colonies can be seen in the pictures below. Aspergillus_germanicus_cya.png|Aspergillus germanicus growing on CYA plate Aspergillus_germanicus_meaox.png|Aspergillus germanicus growing on MEAOX plate ==References== ==Further reading== * germanicus Category:Fungi described in 2011
title: Aspergillus germanicus
